documentedSymbols.name: Package
documentedSymbols.description: Mongoose 8's official types enforce `_id: Types.ObjectId` in the Document type, which prevents using custom ID types like strings, UUIDs, or GUIDs. This package provides modified type definitions that allow `_id` to be any type, enabling full flexibility for ID management.

documentedSymbols.name: Use
documentedSymbols.description: - Using string-based IDs (UUIDs, GUIDs, custom formats) - Migrating from other databases with non-ObjectId primary keys - Building systems that require specific ID formats - Cross-platform applications with custom ID providers

documentedSymbols.name: Cases
documentedSymbols.description: - Using string-based IDs (UUIDs, GUIDs, custom formats) - Migrating from other databases with non-ObjectId primary keys - Building systems that require specific ID formats - Cross-platform applications with custom ID providers

documentedSymbols.name: T
documentedSymbols.description: - `Document<T>` generic parameter `T` default changed from `Types.ObjectId` to `any`

documentedSymbols.name: any
documentedSymbols.description: - `Document<T>` generic parameter `T` default changed from `Types.ObjectId` to `any`

documentedSymbols.name: Changes
documentedSymbols.description: - `Document<T>` generic parameter `T` default changed from `Types.ObjectId` to `any` - Updated JSDoc to clarify that `_id` can be ObjectId, string, or any custom type - All other Mongoose functionality remains unchanged

documentedSymbols.name: Official
documentedSymbols.description: - `Document<T>` generic parameter `T` default changed from `Types.ObjectId` to `any` - Updated JSDoc to clarify that `_id` can be ObjectId, string, or any custom type - All other Mongoose functionality remains unchanged

documentedSymbols.name: Mongoose
documentedSymbols.description: - `Document<T>` generic parameter `T` default changed from `Types.ObjectId` to `any` - Updated JSDoc to clarify that `_id` can be ObjectId, string, or any custom type - All other Mongoose functionality remains unchanged

documentedSymbols.name: Types
documentedSymbols.description: - `Document<T>` generic parameter `T` default changed from `Types.ObjectId` to `any` - Updated JSDoc to clarify that `_id` can be ObjectId, string, or any custom type - All other Mongoose functionality remains unchanged

documentedSymbols.name: Versioning
documentedSymbols.description: This package follows Mongoose's version numbers. Version `8.20.1` corresponds to Mongoose `8.20.1` types with custom ID support.

documentedSymbols.name: Contributing
documentedSymbols.description: Contributions are welcome! Please open an issue or PR at [https://github.com/Digital-Defiance/mongoose-types](https://github.com/Digital-Defiance/mongoose-types)

examples.code:
npm install @digitaldefiance/mongoose-types mongoose@^8.20.0
# or
yarn add @digitaldefiance/mongoose-types mongoose@^8.20.0

issues.message: Code example references symbols (Document, Schema, model, Types, IUser) that are not tested
issues.recommendation: Add tests that validate this example works correctly, or ensure the referenced symbols are tested
Add more tests to increase statement coverage.
